001package io.github.ai4ci.util;
002
003import java.util.HashMap;
004import java.util.Map;
005import java.util.function.Function;
006
007/**
008 * Memoised is a utility class that implements memoization for a given function.
009 * It caches the results of function calls to avoid redundant computations and
010 * improve performance for expensive functions.
011 *
012 * @param <X> the type of the input to the function
013 * @param <Y> the type of the output of the function
014 */
015public class Memoised<X, Y> implements Function<X, Y> {
016
017        /**
018         * Creates a memoized version of the given function. The returned function
019         * will cache results for previously computed inputs, improving performance
020         * for expensive functions.
021         *
022         * @param <X> the type of the input to the function
023         * @param <Y> the type of the output of the function
024         * @param fn  the function to be memoized
025         * @return a memoized version of the given function
026         */
027        public static <X, Y> Memoised<X, Y> memoise(Function<X, Y> fn) {
028                return new Memoised<>(fn);
029        }
030
031        Function<X, Y> fn;
032
033        Map<X, Y> cache = new HashMap<>();
034
035        private Memoised(Function<X, Y> fn) {
036                this.fn = fn;
037        }
038
039        @Override
040        /**
041         * Applies the memoized function to the given input. If the result for the
042         * input is already cached, it returns the cached value. Otherwise, it
043         * computes the result using the original function, caches it, and returns
044         * it.
045         *
046         * @param t the input to the function
047         * @return the output of the function for the given input
048         */
049        public Y apply(X t) {
050                return this.cache.computeIfAbsent(t, this.fn);
051        }
052}
